intro: Neomirandea folsomiana, commonly known as the Folsom's ghostflower, is a rare and delicate plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, pale flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, adapting to harsh desert conditions. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it faces significant threats to its survival.
